title: 105_hr120
content:
The Act titled "Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997" defines key terms. Section 101 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to clarify various terms and make technical corrections. SEC. 3. ADJUSTMENT OF DOLLAR AMOUNTS. Section 104 of title 11, United States Code, is amended by inserting ``522(f)(3),'' after ``522(d),'' each place it appears. SEC. 4. EXTENSION OF TIME. Section 108(c)(2) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by striking ``922'' and all that follows through ``or'', and inserting ``922, 1201, or''. SEC. 5. PENALTY FOR PERSONS WHO NEGLIGENTLY OR FRAUDULENTLY PREPARE BANKRUPTCY PETITIONS. Section 110(j)(3) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by striking ``attorney's'' and inserting ``attorneys' ''. SEC. 6. ELIGIBILITY TO SERVE AS TRUSTEE. Paragraphs (1) and (2) of section 321(a) of title 11, United States Code, are amended by striking ``7, 12,'' and inserting ``12''. SEC. 7. EMPLOYMENT OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. (a) Authority of Trustee.--Section 327 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to update subsections (b), (c), and (d) regarding the trustee's authority and professional services. 
(b) Limitation on Compensation.--Section 328(b) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to specify the type of professional services and persons eligible for compensation. The amendment updates Section 327 of title 11, United States Code, regarding the authority of the trustee and professional services. It specifies the type of professional persons eligible for compensation under Section 328(b). The amendment includes changes to terminology such as replacing "attorney or accountant" with "professional person who renders such services." SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON COMPENSATION OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Amends Section 328(a) of title 11, United States Code, to include compensation "on a fixed or percentage fee basis."

SEC. 7. COMPENSATION TO OFFICERS. Amends Section 330(a) of title 11, United States Code, regarding compensation to officers and the debtor's attorney.

SEC. 8. SPECIAL TAX PROVISIONS. Amends Section 346(g)(1)(C) of title 11, United States Code, by striking certain language.

SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. Amends Section 348(f)(2) of title 11, United States Code, regarding the effect of conversion on property of the estate.

SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY. SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. Section 348(f)(2) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by inserting "of the estate" after "property" the first place it appears. SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY. Section 362 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include specific provisions related to security interests and entities. SEC. 11. EXECUTORY CONTRACTS AND UNEXPIRED LEASES. Section 365 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include provisions related to the satisfaction of penalty rates in executory contracts or unexpired leases, as well as provisions relating to defaults arising from nonmonetary obligations. Subsection (c) is also amended to remove paragraph (4). Section 365 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include provisions related to penalty rates in contracts or leases. Subsection (c) is further amended by removing certain paragraphs. SEC. 12. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF SECTIONS.

Amends the item relating to section 556 in chapter 5 to include a contractual right to liquidate commodities or forward contracts.

SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES.

Amends section 503(b)(4) of title 11, United States Code, to include subparagraphs (A), (B), (C), (D), or (E) before paragraph (3).

SEC. 14. PRIORITIES.

Amends section 507(a) of title 11, United States Code to make adjustments in paragraphs (3)(B) and (7).

SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS.

Amends section 522 of title 11, United States Code, by adjusting liabilities and designations. Section 523 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include new provisions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. Additionally, subsection (a)(17) is modified to specify debts imposed on a prisoner by a Federal court. Section 523 of title 11, United States Code is amended to include new provisions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. Subsection (a)(17) is modified to specify debts imposed on a prisoner by a Federal court, and subsection (e) is updated to correct a typographical error. Section 17 amends Section 524(a)(3) of title 11, US Code, regarding discharge effects. Section 18 modifies Section 525(c) concerning protection against discriminatory treatment. Section 19 amends Section 541(b)(4)(B)(ii) related to property of the estate. Section 20 addresses limitations on avoiding powers. SEC. 19. Amends Section 541(b)(4)(B)(ii) of title 11, US Code by inserting "365 or" before "542". SEC. 20. Redesignates the second subsection (g) of Section 546 as subsection (h). SEC. 21. Addresses liability of transferee of avoided transfer. SEC. 21 amends Section 550(c) of title 11, US Code regarding the liability of a transferee of an avoided transfer. It clarifies the recoverability of transfers made for the benefit of a non-insider transferee. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to Section 547(b) of title 11. SEC. 22 amends Section 553(b)(1) of title 11, US Code by changing a reference from "362(b)(14)" to "362(b)(17)". SEC. 23 modifies Section 726(b) by removing a reference to "1009," and SEC. 24 adjusts Section 901(a) by adding "1123(d)," after "1123(b),". SEC. 25 pertains to the appointment of an elected trustee. Section 901(a) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by inserting ``1123(d),'' after ``1123(b),''. Section 1104(b) is amended to address the appointment of an elected trustee, outlining the process and resolution of disputes. SEC. 26-30 amends various sections of title 11, United States Code, related to railroad line abandonment, plan contents, payments, and discharge. Key changes include updating references and subsections. SEC. 29 amends section 1228 of title 11, United States Code by updating references. SEC. 30 modifies section 1322 by adjusting subsections. SEC. 31 alters section 1328(a) by specifying types of debts not eligible for discharge. SEC. 32 amends section 1334(d) of title 28, United States Code by updating references. SEC. 33 revises section 604 of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994 by redesignating subsections. SEC. 34 addresses knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 33 amends the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994 by redesignating subsections. SEC. 34 addresses knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 35 specifies the effective date and application of amendments. SEC. 35 specifies that the Act and its amendments will take effect on the enactment date, with the amendments applying to cases under title 11 of the United States Code initiated after the enactment date.
